Comment: To summarize:  She went to a foreign medical school - the American University of the Caribbean- but tried to say she "Initially pursuing training at the American University" leaving out the "of the Caribbean" part where it tells you its not American University.  She took 6 years to graduate instead of 4.   In US medical schools, unless you are getting an MD/PhD that is rare and typically would involve childbirth or a significant medical issue.    She then went to family medicine residency at the University of Arkansas which is a perfectly fine place to train but she lied about that, too.  She said she was a board-certified emergency medicine and family physician when she did not, in fact, receive any residency training or board certification in Emergency Medicine.
